intro: Achyranthes picta, commonly known as the redroot pigweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive red stems. The plant produces small, green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Achyranthes picta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
